Row.Text: Commercial Hub receives +1 [ICON_GOLD] Gold from the adjacent other districts. All districts receive +2 additional standard adjacency bonus for being adjacent to oasis.

[ICON_Governor] Governors established in a city provide +3% [ICON_Culture] Culture for each Promotion they have earned, including their first. Mines provide +1 [ICON_SCIENCE] Science if adjacent to an Industrial Zone.

[ICON_TradeRoute] Trade Routes to foreign cities provide +3 [ICON_Gold] Gold and +1 [ICON_Culture] Culture to you. [ICON_TradeRoute] Trade Routes to foreign cities or from foreign cities provide +1 [ICON_GOLD] Gold to you.[ICON_TradeRoute] Trade Routes from foreign cities provide +2 [ICON_FOOD] Food to you. Other civilizations' [ICON_TradeRoute] Trade Routes to Egypt provide +2 [ICON_Gold] Gold for them.
Open Borders with all city-states. Each time you found your first city on a continent other than your home continent receive a [ICON_TradeRoute] Trade Route capacity.
Italy receives +1 [ICON_GreatMerchant] Great Merchant point from Bank and +1 [ICON_GreatAdmiral] Great Admiral point from Shipyard.

Extra territory upon founding cities. Allows Farms to be built on Tundra terrain. After Civil Engineering is unlocked Farms can be built on Tundra Hills. Units do not receive damage from Blizzards. Civilizations that are at war with U.S.S.R. receive +100% unit damage from Blizzards in U.S.S.R. territory.

Get a Settler when conqure the Barbarian Camp. Begin the game with the Animal Husbandry technologies unlocked. Can't hire a Great Merchant. Borrows city names excluding the capital from the city names of other civilizations.
Gains +2% [ICON_Science] Science for each Great Person it has ever earned, up to a total of +30%. Farms can be built on the hills from Ancient era.

Earn a Great Pirates when the game enters a new era. Begin the game with the Sailing technologies unlocked. Begin the game with the Shipbuilding and Celestial Navigation technology [ICON_TechBoosted] Eureka. Harbor districts in half the time.

+1 [ICON_Movement] Movement to military melee units. +2 [ICON_CULTURE] Culture to each city with encampment. +1 [ICON_CULTURE] Culture to each city with buildings on encampment. All military units heal completely when this player captures a city with a encampment.
All Cavalry units Gain [ICON_GOLD] Gold equal to 100% that unit's base [ICON_Strength] Combat Strength. Allows city to purchase districts with [ICON_Gold] Gold when this player captures a city.

Roads built in your territory are one level more advanced than usual. Receive +2 [ICON_Production] Production for routes between your own cities. [ICON_TradeRoute] Trade Routes to foreign cities provide +2 [ICON_Gold] Gold to you.
Gain +3 [ICON_Strength] Combat Strength bonus when defending to all units. Cities with a garrisoned unit get +3 Loyalty per turn, or +5 if it is a Corps or Army.

All Units have +3 [ICON_Strength] Combat Strength from each active Alliance. Accumulate 25% less war weariness than usual. Fishing Boats provides +1 [ICON_Culture] Culture. +1 [ICON_Culture] Culture if Fishing Boats on a reef. +1 [ICON_Culture] Culture if Fishing Boats adjecent to reef.

Can move their original [ICON_Capital] Capital to any city with a Feitoria they founded by completing a unique project in that city. Each time you found city on a continent other than your home continent receive +4 Identity per turn.
All improved strategic resources yield 1 additional resource per turn. Builds Encampment, Campus and Industrial Zone Square districts in half the time.

Can declare a War of Territorial Expansion after gaining the Military Tradition Civic. +2 [ICON_Movement] Movement for the first 20 turns after declaring a War of Territorial Expansion. Mins provide +1 [ICON_Science] Science if adjacent to an Hansa.
+1 [ICON_FAVOR] Diplomatic Favor per turn for every Military slot in their government. Military melee units and Naval melee units increases +100% Flanking bonus.

+2 [ICON_Housing] Housing to all cities. +50% [ICON_PRODUCTION] Production towards Industrial Zone and Dam buildings. +25% [ICON_Production] Production to nuclear program projects and Nuclear Devices.
+50% [ICON_Production] Production toward all air units and toward Carriers. No [ICON_Strength] Combat Strength and [ICON_Movement] Movement penalty when attacking from sea.

The effects of the Battering Ram and Siege Tower also apply to cavalry units. All Cavalry Units have escort mobility shared. Can not conqure the city built by other civilization without capital and it is forcibly destroyed. Get a lot of gold from the forcible destruction of the cities(Depends on game speed).
The sea is the border of my rice field

+1 [ICON_GreatScientist] Great Scientist point from cities with a Campus district. +1 [ICON_GreatGeneral] Great General point from cities with a Encampment district. +30% [ICON_PRODUCTION] Production towards Campus and Encampment buildings. All Military Units receives +5 [ICON_Strength] Strength from the adjecent other class military units.(This effects are not duplicate, Heavy Cavalry class and Light Cavalry class treated as the same class, Excludes special units like Warrior Monk.)

All Navy units except aircraft carriers have coastal plunder capabilities and may capture enemy Navy units except aircraft carriers. Combat victories provide [ICON_Gold] Gold equal to 100% of the [ICON_Strength] Combat Strength of the defeated unit.(on Standard Speed)
Timurid unique Medieval era unit. Replace the Courser. Can escort moving civilian and support units at their higher [ICON_Movement] Movement speed.
Yugoslavia unique Atomic era unit. Replace the Artillery. No [ICON_Movement] Movement penalty in Hill terrain. No need Oil.
Yugoslavia unique unit: Mountain Gun M48
Kingdom of Morocco unique Industrial era unit. Replace the Cavalry. +5 [ICON_Strength] Combat Strength bonus on Desert.
Kingdom of Morocco unique unit: Berbers Cavalry
Hideki Tojo unique Atomic era unit. Replace the Fighter. Gains +5 [ICON_Strength] Combat Strength against fighter aircraft, lower maintenace cost than fighter and gains +50% experience.
Hideki Tojo unique unit: Zero Fighter

Portugal unique Renaissance era unit. Replace the Caravel. +1 [ICON_Movement] Movement, +1 Sight. Formation units all inherit escort's [ICON_Movement] Movement speed. Trader units are immune to being plundered if they are within 4 tiles of a Nau and on a water tile.
U.S.S.R. unique Modern era unit. Replace the Tank. +5 [ICON_Strength] Combat Strength.
Adolf Hitler unique Atomic era unit. +10 [ICON_Strength] Strength to heavy cavalry unit and naval ranged unit.
Italy unique Industrial era unit. +10 [ICON_Strength] Combat Strength when fighting on your capital's continent. [ICON_GreatGeneral] Great General points for killing units.
Churchill unique Modern era unit. 90 [ICON_Bombard] Bombard, 6 [ICON_Range] Range. Use [ICON_RESOURCE_IRON] Iron.
Truman unique Industrial era unit. Replace the Ranger. +10 [ICON_Strength] Melee Combat Strength, 2 [ICON_Range] Range. +5 [ICON_Strength] Combat Strength bonus if target is in the forest or jungle.
Huns unique Classical era unit. Replace the Horseman. +2 [ICON_Strength] Combat Strength, +1 Sight. Pillaging costs 1 [ICON_Movement] Movement.
Madagascar unique Classical era unit. Replace the Swordsman. Can built Farm.
Republic of Pirates unique Great People unit.
Republic of Pirates unique unit: Great Pirates

Republic of Pirates unique Renaissance era melee unit. Replace the Musketman. +2 [ICON_Strength] Strength. +5 [ICON_Strength] Combat Strength when fighting a wounded opponent. Use [ICON_RESOURCE_IRON] Iron.
Republic of Pirates unique unit: Buccaneer
A building unique to Timurid. Replaces the University. +5 [ICON_Science] Science, +1 [ICON_Amenities] Amenity. Bonus [ICON_Culture] Culture equal to the adjacency bonus of the Campus district.
A building unique to U.S.S.R., Replaces the Research Lab. +4 [ICON_Science] Science, +2 [ICON_GreatScientist]. 15% [ICON_Production] Production increase to all space-program projects in the city.
U.S.S.R. unique building: Space Research Lab

A building unique to Republic of Pirates. Replaces the Granary. +1 [ICON_Food] Food, +2 [ICON_Housing] Housing and +1 [ICON_Amenities] Amenity. +1 [ICON_Food] Food and +2 [ICON_Gold] Gold from [ICON_RESOURCE_RICE] Rice, [ICON_RESOURCE_WHEAT] Wheat, [ICON_RESOURCE_MAIZE] Maize, [ICON_RESOURCE_SUGAR] Sugar, [ICON_RESOURCE_BANANAS] Bananas, [ICON_RESOURCE_HONEY] Honey and [ICON_RESOURCE_WINE] Wine.
Republic of Pirates unique building: Brewery

A district unique to Portugal Empire. Replaces the Encampment. +1 [ICON_Amenities] Amenity. It does not lower the appeal. +1 [ICON_Production] Production and +1 [ICON_Food] Food for every two adjecent Coast tiles. +1 [ICON_Production] Production and +1 [ICON_Food] Food for each adjecent Harbor/Canal tiles. +1 [ICON_Gold] Gold for each adjacent Plantations and Mines.
+{1_num} [ICON_Production] Production from the adjacent every two Coast tiles.
+{1_num} [ICON_Food] Food from the adjacent every two Coast tiles.
+{1_num} [ICON_Production] Production from the adjacent Harbor district.
+{1_num} [ICON_Food] Food from the adjacent Harbor district.
+{1_num} [ICON_Production] Production from the adjacent Canal district.
+{1_num} [ICON_Food] Food from the adjacent Canal district.
+{1_num} [ICON_Gold] Gold from the adjacent {1_Num : plural 1?Plantation; other?Plantations;}.

A district unique to Madagascar. Replaces the Neighborhood. +4 [ICON_Housing] Housing(increase with appeal) and +1 [ICON_Amenities] Amenity. +1 [ICON_Food] Food for every two adjecent Farm tiles. +1 [ICON_Production] Production for each adjecent Aqueduct and Canal districts. +1 [ICON_Gold] Gold for each adjecent Plantation tiles. (These adjacency bonuses will increase points as the Civics and Technologies are unlocked.)
+{1_num} [ICON_Food] Food from the adjacent every two Farm tiles.
+{1_num} [ICON_Food] Food from the adjacent every Farm tile.
+{1_num} [ICON_Production] Production from the adjacent Aqueduct district.
+{1_num} [ICON_Production] Production from the adjacent Canal district.
+{1_num} [ICON_Gold] Gold from the adjacent every Plantation tile.

Unlocks the Builder ability to construct a Stecci, unique to Yugoslavia.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]+1 [ICON_Culture] Culture, +1 [ICON_Faith] Faith, +3 [ICON_Amenities] Amenity. One per City. Can be built on flat place.

Unlocks the Builder ability to construct a Casbah, unique to Kingdom of Morocco.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]+1 [ICON_Production] Production, +1 [ICON_Gold] Gold, +1 [ICON_Food] Food, +0.5 [ICON_Housing] Housing. Receive +1 [ICON_Gold] Gold if adjacent to other Casbah. Can be built on Desert, Desert Hills and Desert Floodplain.
Kingdom of Morocco unique improvement: Casbah

Unlocks the Builder ability to construct a Duomo, unique to Italy.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]+1 [ICON_Faith] Faith, +1 [ICON_Amenities] Amenity. +2 [ICON_Food] Food if adjacent to a city center. For all other districts that award adjacency bonuses: +2 of the appropriate yield if that district is adjacent. One per city. Can be built on flat land.

Unlocks the Builder ability to construct a Yurt, unique to Huns.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]+1 [ICON_Production] Production, +1 [ICON_Housing] Housing. +1 [ICON_Food] Food for each adjacent Camp or Pasture. +1 [ICON_Culture] Culture for each adjacent Plantation. Can only be built on flat Grass or flat Plains. Cannot be built adjacent to another Yurt. Additional [ICON_Production] Production and [ICON_Tourism] Tourism from Yurt's [ICON_Food] Food as you advance through the Civic Tree and Technology Tree.

Unlocks the Builder ability to construct a Rova, unique to Madagascar.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]+1 [ICON_Science] Science, +1 [ICON_Culture] Culture, +1 [ICON_Housing] Housing. +1 [ICON_Science] Science for each adjacent Foko. +1 [ICON_Culture] Culture adjacent City Center. Can only be built on Hills. One per city.
Your Trader units are immune to being plundered on water tiles.
Your Civilization gains +2% [ICON_Culture] Culture for each Great Person it has ever earned, up to a total of +30%.

Your Builders can now make Trading Dome improvements.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]+2 [ICON_GOLD] Gold. +1 [ICON_Gold] Gold for every adjacent Luxury resource. Your outgoing international [ICON_TradeRoute] Trade Routes grant +1 [ICON_GOLD] Gold per Trading Dome at the origin. Cannot be built next to another Trading Dome.
